intro: Hemizonia fremontii, commonly known as the Fremont's hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms in the spring. Hemizonia fremontii is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
